item.title: Trisha add a quote by Rachel Morgan
item.description: "I would have thought you’d pay more attention to your closest competition.” “I would—if you were competition worth paying attention to." -- Rachel Morgan

item.title: Trisha add a quote by Rachel Morgan
item.description: "Creepy Hollow?” He snorts. “Like <i>Sleepy Hollow</i>?” “No, like Creepy Hollow. It has nothing to do with sleeping." -- Rachel Morgan

item.title: Trisha add a quote by Rachel Morgan
item.description: "You guys dated, didn’t you?” “Are you insane? Not even if the continuation of our kind depended on it would I be tempted to do something so awful." -- Rachel Morgan

item.title: Trisha add a quote by Rachel Morgan
item.description: "Is that what you were doing in my room?” he asks after a moment. I sigh. Why am I telling him any of this? “Yes. I was on assignment.” “I was your assignment?” “Yes.” He hesitates a moment, then grins. “That’s kind of hot." -- Rachel Morgan

item.title: Trisha add a quote by Rachel Morgan
item.description: "Seelie Court,” murmurs Nate. “Sounds familiar. Was it in a computer game?” “Do I look like someone who plays computer games?” A grin stretches across Nate’s face. “You look like someone who could <i>be</i> in a computer game." -- Rachel Morgan

item.title: Trisha add a quote by Rachel Morgan
item.description: "Are you serious? Vi’s arm has been magically barbequed and you think she needs a <i>cupcake</i>?" -- Rachel Morgan

item.title: Trisha add a quote by A.S. King
item.description: "It also makes my father right again. How will I ever soar with the eagles if I'm surrounded by turkeys?" -- A.S. King

item.title: Trisha add a quote by Dean Koontz
item.description: "Not funny ha ha, funny weird" -- Dean Koontz

item.title: Trisha add a quote by Michael S. Atkinson
item.description: "I'm holding a super-expandable energy-powered towel. I've made friends with space hamsters. I think we've stretched believability rather far, don't you?" -- Michael S. Atkinson

item.title: Trisha add a quote by M. Pax
item.description: "He feared what getting involved with her might mean, but he wanted this deal involving chocolate and would risk lying with something not entirely female to get it." -- M. Pax

item.title: Trisha add a quote by Michael S. Atkinson
item.description: "There are a lot of fun vacation spots in the universe; the bug-pits of Aylorta Five are not one of them." -- Michael S. Atkinson

item.title: Trisha add a quote by Rachel Hawkins
Trisha add a quote by M. Pax
item.description: "You can take a flyin’ leap off a space dock." -- M. Pax

item.title: Trisha add a quote by M. Pax
item.description: "It made Craze smile, despite wishing most of his body parts would find new homes and leave him in peace." -- M. Pax

item.title: Trisha add a quote by Kyra Lennon
item.description: "Erica had asked me a million times. 'Madison, are you sure you’re just the child minder? He pays you a lot of money for doing hardly anything.' Pushing aside the blatant insinuation that I was his weekend whore, I’d always told her the absolute truth. He’d never so much as looked at me inappropriately, let alone anything more." -- Kyra Lennon

item.title: Trisha add a quote by Kyra Lennon
item.description:
"I focused, rather embarrassingly, on his chest which was rising and falling slowly.
I left teeth marks!" -- Kyra Lennon

item.title: Trisha add a quote by Kyra Lennon
item.description: "His jaw was set, telling me I should back off. Unfortunately, being a gobby cow meant I couldn’t." -- Kyra Lennon

item.title: Trisha add a quote by Flann O'Brien
item.description: "When things go wrong and will not come right, Though you do the best you can, When life looks black as the hour of night, A PINT OF PLAIN IS YOUR ONLY MAN." -- Flann O'Brien

item.title: Trisha add a quote by Flann O'Brien
item.description: "With these words there came the rending scream of a shattered stirk and an angry troubling of the branches as the poor madman percolated through the sieve of a sharp yew, a wailing black meteor hurtling through green clouds, a human prickles." -- Flann O'Brien

item.title: Trisha add a quote by Flann O'Brien
item.description: "When money's tight and is hard to get And your horse has also ran, When all you have is a heap of debt A PINT OF PLAIN IS YOUR ONLY MAN." -- Flann O'Brien

item.title: Trisha add a quote by Flann O'Brien
item.description: "For my sustenance at night, the whole that my hands can glean from the gloom of the oak-gloomed oaks-- the herbs and the plenteous fruits..." -- Flann O'Brien

item.title: Trisha add a quote by Ian Livingstone
item.description: "The warm days of Firestreak are usually good for travellers in the world of Amarillia." -- Ian Livingstone

item.title: Trisha add a quote by Ian Livingstone
item.description: "Friend, we are well met indeed. I think we are a pair of fools and that we should hasten to Nildren's Peak, where I shall buy ye such a dinner as even your great frame will find sufficient. And then we shall see who can drink the other under the table. Is that good by ye?" -- Ian Livingstone

item.title: Trisha add a quote by Carl Sargent
item.description: "Hirsute? What does that mean?' 'Hair, you ninny, hair!" -- Carl Sargent

item.title: Trisha add a quote by Carl Sargent
item.description: "By Duraden, I have trolls dancing in my head this morning!' Stubble grumbled, screwing his eyes into a squint at the bright morning light." -- Carl Sargent

item.title: Trisha add a quote by Carl Sargent
item.description: "I think this goat must have been fed on old boots,' Stubble complained as he chewed the last scraps of flesh from the bones littering his stew." -- Carl Sargent

item.title: Trisha add a quote by Carl Sargent
item.description: "Has Solan addled your brain?" -- Carl Sargent

item.title: Trisha add a quote by Ian Livingstone
item.description: "Well, anyway, this'll be easier than knocking an elf out of a tree. Trust me.' 'How many elves have you knocked out of trees, Stubble?' 'Duraden's bones! Have ye never heard of a figure of speech?" -- Ian Livingstone

item.title: Trisha add a quote by Ian Livingstone
item.description: "Solan is descending in the sky..." -- Ian Livingstone

item.title: Trisha add a quote by Ian Livingstone
item.description: "I am come,' the Demon said simply, in a droning monotone. 'I am with the dead of the lake. Come to me.' Then the appearance of the skull-face vanished and the blood burst into a shroud of flame, spreading through the throne room in a storm of brilliant red and yellow. The screams could be heard half a league away." -- Ian Livingstone
